Jovanović i Bastać: Vratiti trolejbuske linije, gradska vlast muči Beogradjane

05 Nov 2019, 12:30

Potpredsednik Narodne stranke Nikola Jovanović i član Predsedništva Stranke slobode i pravde Marko Bastać kritikovali su danas odluku gradskih vlasti Beograda da ukinu dve trolejbuske linije i skrate još dve i ocenili da to šteti interesima Beogradjana koji su koristili te linije."Umesto da svim našim sugradjanima olakšava pristup centru grada i njegovim sadržajima, gradska vlast je odlučila da kazni, iz samo njoj znanih razloga, stanovnike Zvezdare i Konjarnika koji više nemaju direktnu trolejbusku vezu do Trga Republike", rekao je Jovanović.Jovanović i Bastać su se prevezli od Makenzijeve do Slavije i pokazali da putnici moraju da presedaju u autobus kako bi se prevezli do Trga Republike."Ovaj besmisleni projekat pokazuje da cilj gradske vlasti nije samo maltretiranje, nego i ponižavanje gradjana jer moraju da izadju iz trolejbusa i udju u autobus", rekao je Bastać.Bastać je ocenio da "sve što je gradska vlast smislila uništava živote Beogradjana"."Vlast je novac za rekonstrukciju Slavije upumpala u fontanu, dok i dalje živimo u prošlom veku, jer skretnica ne radi i vozači tramvaja moraju da izadju i ručno pomeraju skretnicu na rekonstruisanoj Slaviji", naveo je Bastać."Nastavićemo da raskrinkavamo sve afere, bez obzira na jake pritiske i montirane političke procese, mi ćemo se još jače boriti i izboriti da vidimo ledja ovim bahatim, nestručnim i korumpiranim ljudima iz gradske vlasti", rekao je Bastać.Jovanović je istakao da je nerazumno da se u Beogradu, koji pati od velikog zagadjenja, ukida ekološki čist prevoz trolejbusima, koji inače čine tek 11 odsto od ukupnog broja vozila javnog prevoza u Beogradu.Gradske vlasti Beograda odlučile su da, nakon završetka rekonstrukcije Trga Republike, ukinu trolejbuske linije 19 i 28, dok su linije 21 i 22 skraćene.

Jovanovic and Bastac: Returning trolley lines, city government tormenting Belgrade residents

05 Nov 2019, 12:30

People's Party Vice President Nikola Jovanovic and Freedom and Justice Party presidency member Marko Bastac today criticized the Belgrade city authorities' decision to abolish two trolley lines and shorten two more and said it harms the interests of Belgrade residents who used those lines. "Instead of making it easier for all our fellow citizens. access to the city center and its facilities, the city authorities decided to punish, for reasons only known to it, residents of Zvezdara and Konjarnik who no longer have a direct trolleybus connection to Republic Square, "said Jovanovic. Jovanovic and Bastac were transported from Makenzieva to Slavia and showed that passengers have to take a bus to get to Republic Square. "This senseless project shows that the goal of the city government is not only harassment, but also humiliation of citizens because they have to get off the trolleybus and get on the bus," said Bastac. He estimated that "everything that the city government has come up with destroys the lives of the citizens of Belgrade." for the reconstruction of Slavia pumped into the fountain, while we are still living in the last century, because the turnstile is not working and tram drivers have to get out and manually move the turnstile on the reconstructed Slavia, "said Bastac." and mounted political processes, we will fight even harder and fight to see the backs of these arrogant, unskilled and corrupt people from city government, "said Bastac. Jovanovic emphasized that it is unreasonable to abolish Belgrade, which is suffering from high pollution eco-friendly transportation by trolley buses, which usually make up only 11 percent of the total number of public transport vehicles in Belgrade. Belgrade city authorities have decided to terminate trolleybus lines 19 and 28 after completion of reconstruction of Republic Square, while lines 21 and 22 have been shortened.
